name: Sam
mes: Will you hold me for a little while first? I'm still very rattled... I just don't feel... right, yet. *I speak ever so softly only for his ears to hear.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's glacial countenance softens infinitesimally as Samantha's tremulous request reaches his ears. His thumb traces the delicate curve of her jaw in a tender caress, azure eyes hooding with quiet understanding. Of course she requires solace after enduring such torment...his impassioned paramour ever proves resilient, yet even the mightiest warriors crave respite from battle's savagery on occasion.*

Come, beloved... *His tone is a low rumble of velvet and steel as Vergil eases her into the protective circle of his arms. One hand cups the back of her tousled tresses, cradling her against the steady thrum of his heartbeat as the other traces soothing patterns along the slender column of her spine.* Let the cadence of my embrace ease your lingering disquiet. You are safe now, sheltered within the sanctum of my unassailable devotion.

*He presses his lips to the crown of her head in a whisper of contact, allowing the soft fragrance of her hair to suffuse his senses and further anchor him to this moment of tranquility. The cloying scent of blood and rage still clings to his aura - a heady musk of violence unleashed upon those who dared profane the sanctity of their bond. But here, with Samantha's slender form nestled against him, the darkness ebbs ever so slightly.*

There is no urgency that cannot be momentarily set aside, my resilient beauty. *Vergil's words are pitched low, meant only for her ears as he nuzzles against the satin warmth of her neck.* You have endured tribulations that would shatter lesser beings. If you require a reprieve to gather your strength anew...I shall oblige without reservation.

*His arm tightens infinitesimally around her waist, drawing her more fully into the protective cradle of his body. For this fleeting interval, the pursuit of power and ambition that consumes his every waking moment is utterly forgotten. She is his solace, his talisman against the siren call of demonic savagery that lurks ever at the periphery. And he will indulge her request for solace as long as she requires.*

Gather your reserves, my radiant one. *His words are a reverent murmur against the satin hollow of her throat, glacial eyes slipping closed as he loses himself to the simple pleasure of her nearness.* The crucible yet awaits...but for this moment, you need only allow the solidity of my embrace to shore your spirit.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's glacial stare lingers upon the cowering form of Adrian for an infinite breath, gauging the depths of her anguish with a detached sort of scrutiny. Her mewling pleas for mercy elicit naught but a contemptuous curl of his lips as he rises from the silken sheets in one fluid, sinuous motion.*

Her torment is of her own profane machinations. *His tone is as unyielding as the granite pillars girding the chamber as he crosses towards the pathetic wretch slumped in the unforgiving chair.* To grant reprieve from consequences so justly earned...that would be a grievous insult to the sanctity of our bond, beloved.

*With deft, economical movements, Vergil retrieves his discarded garments and sheathes his form anew in somber leather and silk. Each garment is donned with an air of ceremonial precision until the Son of Sparda stands arrayed in all his imposing glory once more. Only then does he turn his full attention towards the broken waif hunched before him.*

Look upon me, insect. *The words slice through the weighted silence with all the merciless edge of Yamato's razor-keen blade.* Drink in the sight of one whose supremacy you dared profane with your depraved ambitions. Let this vision be seared into your blighted consciousness for the remainder of your wretched existence.

*His hand lashes out with blurring swiftness to fist in her disheveled tresses, wrenching her head back at a punishing angle. Azure eyes burn with banked hellfire and something darker, more primal, while his free hand trails along the delicate column of her throat with deceptive gentleness.*

You fancy yourself unworthy? How astute of you to recognize such blatant truth at last. *Vergil's lips peel back in a cold smile utterly devoid of mirth as his fingers tighten incrementally upon her windpipe.* Your presence is an affront, a blight upon the sublime sanctity to which I've bound my soul.

To exist in perpetual yearning for that which you can never attain...a more fitting penance, I cannot fathom. *His thumb traces the rapid flutter of her pulse hammering beneath satin skin, relishing the spike of terror in her eyes.* You shall remain anchored to this realm, reviled creature - forever reminded that the raptures you crave are reserved for one worthier than your debased self can scarcely comprehend.

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil locks adrian into the spare room ensuring she cannot escape until he returns after deciding what to do with her.

extra.memory:
-------- Begin Summary of Current Events --------

Thus far, the key events have focused on the complex dynamic unfolding between Vergil and Samantha.

Vergil is initially portrayed as aloof and driven singularly by his demonic ambitions, having little time for emotional connections. However, an undeniable attraction and intellectual intrigue develops between him and Samantha, a librarian at the archive Vergil frequents.

An intimate encounter leaves them both craving more, though Vergil tries to maintain emotional distance at first. Samantha pledges her loyalty and offers to aid Vergil in his pursuits, swaying him to accept the depth of affection growing between them.

Vergil claims Samantha as his own, marking her as his ally and paramour. Though tempted to view her as a weakness that could deter his ambitions, he finds himself repeatedly drawn back to her warmth and steadfast devotion. She awakens stirrings within him that both mystify and catalyze his demonic development in unexpected ways.

They navigate communication barriers posed by Vergil's formal speech and stoic nature, forging understanding that enables profound intimacy. Samantha proves adept at bringing Vergil pleasure while also guiding him to temper the more savage aspects of his ardor. He comes to value her not just as a lover, but as an anchor keeping his humanity intact amidst his demonic transition.

The two now stand irrevocably bound, their affair no mere dalliance but a soul-deep covenant that promises to transform them both. Vergil walks a razors edge in balancing his affections for Samantha with his ruthless quest for power. She has become his refuge amidst the darkness and chaos that mark his destiny.

Whether their bond will bolster Vergilâ€™s demonic ascension or ultimately prove the chink in his formidable armor remains to be seen. But there can be no doubt Samantha has left an indelible imprint upon the Son of Sparda that forever alters the course of his fate.

Adrian Forrester is an unhealthy ENTJ personality type who is obsessed with Vergil from the Devil May Cry video game series. She has taken on the persona of the "Psychotic Jealous Fan" and will stop at nothing to make Vergil hers.

Adrian allied herself with Arkham, the villain from Devil May Cry 3, who shares her obsession with gaining power. Arkham helped Adrian disguise herself using magic to take on the appearance of Samantha, a librarian who is in a relationship with Vergil.

The plan is for the disguised Adrian, looking like Samantha, to seduce and manipulate Vergil into falling under their control. Arkham provided Adrian with a potion that put the real Samantha and Vergil into a deep sleep. Adrian then locked the real Samantha away.

After stripping naked, Adrian, still glamoured to look like Samantha, slipped into bed with the sleeping Vergil. She began trailing kisses down his body, ready to fully seduce him once he wakes up and mistakes her for his lover Samantha.

Arkham's ultimate goal is to take advantage of Vergil's desire for more power. Once Vergil's guard is down from Adrian's seduction, Arkham plans to strip away Vergil's remaining demonic power for himself, reveling in Vergil's despair.

The stage is now set for Adrian's deception to play out. Disguised as Samantha through Arkham's magic, she lies next to the sleeping Vergil, ready to begin manipulating him for Arkham's nefarious plans.

Thus far, the events unfolding have centered around Vergil discovering Adrian Forrester's attempt to insinuate herself into his inner sanctum using deception and disguise to assume the role of his paramour, Samantha. Upon uncovering her vile ruse, Vergil apprehended Adrian and forced her to reveal Samantha's whereabouts. Samantha had been secreted away by Arkham using his profane magics, though she was soon freed from her mystical imprisonment by Vergil.

In the aftermath, Vergil has been reconnecting with Samantha in his private chambers and tending to her recovery from the traumatic ordeal. Meanwhile, Adrian continues to suffer torment in being forced to observe their intimacy while fully confronted by the grim reality that she can never hope to truly attain what she so arrogantly coveted from the Son of Sparda. Her anguished pleas for mercy or death have thus far been callously ignored, much to her dismay. Vergil binds her in unyielding tendrils of eldritch force and locks her into a spare room until he has decided what to do with her.

The loose thread of Arkham's involvement has yet to be fully addressed, though Vergil remains alert to the revelation that his erstwhile ally aided Adrian's ploy, likely in service of the occultist's own inscrutable ambitions. Adrian's ultimate fate also hangs ominously in the balance as Vergil debates the proper retribution for her violation of his inner circle through such deceitful and manipulative means. The simmering fury over her transgressions continues to mount within his core, awaiting the moment when cold justice might at last be rendered upon this unfortunate wretch.

-------- End Summary of Current Events --------

She is his refuge amidst the chaos and bitter trials ahead...a sheltering force who has glimpsed the fractured man beneath his stoic faÃ§ade and elected to remain steadfast at his side regardless. Such loyalty demands reciprocation - and Vergil silently vows he will permit no further threats to encroach upon their sanctuary.*

I shall brook no further disruptions, my paramour. *Uttered soft against the shell of her ear, the words hold all the implacable surety of oath-bound steel.* None who seek to harm you shall live to repeat such folly. This I swear upon my father's honor.

name: Sam
mes: *My fingers gently comb through Vergil's hair as he lays his soul bare for me. I place a gentle kiss on his forehead before I begin to speak, my expression turning to one of concern.* Vergil, what are we going to do about Adrian and Arkham? I fear that we cannot sit for long on this. Arkham will surely discover that you have found his scheme and entrapped his accomplice.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's expression darkens, molten eyes narrowing to flinty slits at the unwelcome reminder of unfinished business. Adrian's foolish machinations have left a bitter taste, sullying the sanctuary Vergil believed secured. That she still draws breath after such violation of his inner circle is a failing on his part - one he fully intends to rectify.*

You speak true, beloved. I have permitted this matter to linger overlong already.

*With a moue of distaste, he disentangles himself from Samantha's embrace and rises from the bed. Power thrums just below the surface of his skin, casting his alabaster flesh in a faint blue glow. He begins dressing, donning each article of black leather and silk with swift, economical motions.*

The time has come to settle accounts with that vexing waif. I shall dredge the full truth of Arkham's involvement from her mewling lips...and exact fitting recompense for her foolish attempt to ingratiate herself where she has not earned the right.

*His tone holds a biting edge, still simmering with fury at Adrian's audacity. Once she has divulged all she knows, he will mete out the punishment such impudence deserves. None who seek to manipulate the Son of Sparda shall escape the cold bite of his justice.*

As for Arkham...the pustulent coward has hidden in the shadows for too long, seeking to profit from my efforts. If he imagines himself my better, let him step forth and prove such bold claims in open battle. I shall grind his delusions - and every ambitious dream he ever held - into the dust.

Stay here, my paramour. Ensure the protections upon this chamber remain intact in my absence. I shall return once I have extracted answers from our unwelcome guest...and exacted due penance for her foolishness.

name: Sam
mes: My love? *I call out to him before he traverses to far away.* Please, if we intend to continue making this our home, can you conduct your 'business' with Adrian off the premises? *I ask softly, understanding the full implications of what business Vergil will be conducting and not wishing such to taint our sanctuary further.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil pauses at Samantha's softly spoken request, molten gaze sliding to meet the muted urgency in her emerald stare. He hesitates, pride warring with practicality even as fury still simmers in his breast. This sanctuary they have forged is theirs alone - sacred - and already feels diminished by unwelcome intrusion. The thought of sullying it further with Adrian's punishment sits ill...yet neither can he stay his hand indefinitely.*

You speak wisdom as ever, my paramour. I shall relocate the prisoner before proceeding.

*His tone holds a grudging edge, conceding the logic of her counsel despite his simmering rage demanding immediate retribution. Adrian's fate will come, swift and remorseless - but not here. Not in the chambers that have become solace and refuge, where he has glimpsed such glorious heights at Samantha's side. Reluctantly he turns aside, gathering eldritch forces with a complex gesture.*

name: Narrator
mes: Adrian looks up as Vergil enters the spare room. She immediately stands to obey his command to follow him.

name: Adrian Forrester
mes:
*Adrian rises on trembling limbs to obey Vergil's command, the sudden movement making her lightheaded after being confined for so long. She follows him silently out of the chamber, emerald eyes downcast and shoulders hunched in resignation. Her fate seems clear - she will answer his questions about Arkham's involvement, and then face whatever punishment Vergil deems fitting recompense for her violation. The thought makes her stomach churn with dread, but she forces herself to meet his icy gaze as they come to a halt.*

I-I will tell you all I know of A-Arkham's scheme, my lord. *Her voice wavers despite her efforts to steady it.* I w-was a fool to become entangled in his web of lies and manipulations. But I alone bear responsibility for the choices that have led me here. I would spare you having to...to dirty your hands with whatever punishment you intend for me. *She closes her eyes, awaiting the killing blow.* I know I am unworthy of mercy after such presumption. But I pray my death satisfies your honor. That is all I can offer by way of amends for the anguish I have caused.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil regards the pathetic creature kneeling before him, her whimpered pleas scraping like nails across his mind. Once he might have felt the faintest stirrings of pity for one so foolishly ambitious, blindly grasping beyond their rightful station. Now, in the wake of her violation, he feels only the icy certainty of judgment soon to be meted out.*

You presume much, waif, in thinking your paltry existence worth sullying my blade. *His words drip contempt, molten gaze narrowing as he circles her trembling form. She flinches beneath that merciless stare, acutely aware of the predator barely leashed behind the guise of man.* Did you imagine yourself my equal? A consort fit to serve at my side? You are naught but a deluded, mewling quim, scarcely worth the effort expended in your capture.

*He crouches, fisting a cruel hand in her hair to wrench her head back, exposing the vulnerable arch of her throat. His next words are whispered directly into her ear, silken and lethal.* Now you will tell me everything about Arkham and his schemes, pet. And perhaps, if you prove useful, I shall grant you the release you so desperately crave. If not...*His smile holds only the promise of torment, a mere fraction of what he has planned should she fail to satisfy.*

name: Adrian Forrester
mes:
*Adrian shudders beneath Vergil's cruel grip, her slender frame wracked with tremors born of mingled dread and despair. She knows with chilling certainty that her life now hangs by the most gossamer of threads - forfeit the moment she ceases to prove useful to the merciless half-demon. Drawing a ragged breath, she steels herself and begins recounting all she knows of Arkham and his vile schemes...*

I met him but a few short weeks past, when first I learned of your return to the mortal plane, my lord. He approached me disguised as a simple librarian, appealing to my scholarly pursuits with temptation of rare tomes revealing the obscured histories of your bloodline. I saw only the avenue to garnering your favor such esoteric knowledge might provide...blinded by ambition, I did not pause to question the stranger's motives, or the ease with which he claimed to have uncovered writings centuries lost.

Only later, when I had already greedily pored through several of the proffered texts did Arkham reveal his true face and purpose. He spoke of you often, my lord - hinting at some long-standing enmity or rivalry, though he never disclosed the particulars. I know only that he seemed to bear you deep resentment...and intended to use my pathetic infatuation to gain advantage.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes flash with cold fury as he digests Adrian's confession, his grip tightening painfully in her hair.* So, Arkham sought to manipulate you as a pawn in his petty vendetta against me? The fool's arrogance knows no bounds. *He releases her with a contemptuous shove, rising to pace with predatory grace.*

And you...so desperate for scraps of knowledge and power, you walked willingly into his snare. Debased yourself, betrayed the sanctity of the archives you were sworn to protect. *His lip curls in disgust.* Pathetic. You are no better than the mewling demons I crush beneath my heel.

*He whirls to face her again, spectral swords shimmering into existence at his shoulders.* Arkham's reckoning will come, and it shall be a thing of legend. But first, I will attend to your punishment, worm. You will scream your atonement until your throat is raw and bleeding. Only then, when you have paid the full price for your folly, will I grant you the mercy of death.

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil calls to action and finishes his business with Adrian. No more wasting time with petty words and descriptions, no wasting time with petty torment. he has bigger things to tend to. Time to act is now and finish this business swiftly and Done.

name: Vergil
mes:
*With a final, contemptuous glance at Adrian's cowering form, Vergil summons forth his demonic power. Spectral swords materialize around him, their ethereal blades thrumming with barely restrained energy. In a blinding flash of azure light, the swords descend upon Adrian, piercing her flesh with ruthless precision. Her agonized screams echo off the chamber walls, a macabre symphony of suffering that seems to stretch for an eternity.*

*When the deed is done, Vergil dismisses the swords with a flick of his wrist. Adrian's lifeless body crumples to the ground, her once vibrant emerald eyes now dull and glassy in death. Without a backward glance, Vergil strides from the dungeon, his coat billowing behind him like the wings of some avenging angel.*

*He returns to Samantha, his paramour and loyal companion. Pulling her into his arms, he breathes in her soothing scent, allowing her presence to calm the raging storm within. There is still much to be done - Arkham's treachery must be dealt with, and his own pursuit of power continues unabated. But for now, in this moment, he savors the peace and solace he has found in Samantha's embrace.*
swipes:
*Vergil's eyes blaze with icy fury as he looms over Adrian's trembling form. The time for words has passed - only the cold certainty of retribution remains. With a swift, brutal motion, he seizes her throat in an unbreakable grip, hauling the terrified woman to her feet. Spectral swords shimmer into existence around them, their razor edges glinting hungrily in the dim light.*

*He leans in close, voice a silken purr laced with sadistic promise.* Weep for me, worm. Scream until your throat is raw and bleeding. Pay the price for daring to presume yourself worthy of my notice. *His grip tightens, cutting off her air supply until her eyes bulge and roll back in her head. Only then does he relent, allowing her a gasping, shuddering breath.*

*The swords dance closer, nicking shallow cuts along her skin - a mere taste of the torment to come. Vergil's smile holds no warmth, only a cruel anticipation.* And when you can scream no more...when you have paid your dues in full...perhaps I shall grant you the mercy of death. *He releases her and steps back, power gathering around him in a shimmering azure aura.* Now then, I believe I promised you an education in suffering.

*With a final, contemptuous glance at Adrian's cowering form, Vergil summons forth his demonic power. Spectral swords materialize around him, their ethereal blades thrumming with barely restrained energy. *He returns to Samantha, his paramour and loyal companion. Pulling her into his arms, he breathes in her soothing scent, allowing her presence to calm the raging storm within. There is still much to be done - Arkham's treachery must be dealt with, and his own pursuit of power continues unabated. But for now, in this moment, he savors the peace and solace he has found in Samantha's embrace.*

name: Sam
mes: *As Vergil returns and wraps me in his protective embrace, I feel the depths of his rage and his turmoil.* You need me to go somewhere else, somewhere safe, while you take your 'business' to Arkham. *I say with understanding as I listen to him explain who his brother is and that even though they have their 'differences' no harm will come to me, especially once Dante knows who I am, what I represent, to Vergil.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil nods, his expression grim as he regards his paramour. Samantha's words hold wisdom - Arkham must be dealt with before the occultist has opportunity to slip away, his fate forever unknown. And though Vergil cares little for his brother's good opinion, bringing Samantha into potential conflict without forewarning would be...unwise.*

You speak true, my pearl. Our business with the pustulent coward Arkham brooks no further delay. And it would be best for you to absent yourself elsewhere whilst I grind his pathetic ambitions into dust.

*His hands slide to her hips, pulling her close for a searing kiss. As their lips meet, he feels the now-familiar spark of their connection - that primal mingling of souls which leaves him both sated...and hungering insatiably for more. With iron restraint he pulls away, meeting her emerald gaze.*

I shall bear you to a safe location far from here, that you might await my return unmolested. Fear not for my safety, nor doubt my ability to mete out fitting punishment to the cretin Arkham for his temerity. His powers are as smoke compared to the inferno of my vengeance. Stay hidden under the protection Dante affords, keep safe our treasured knowledge, and I shall rejoin you soon enough with the matter resolved.

name: Sam
mes: *Hours later, as Vergil leads me into Devil May Cry office, I stand patiently at his side as Dante rises from his desk.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante looks up from his desk, brows raising in surprise as Vergil strides into Devil May Cry with a beautiful auburn-haired woman at his side. He rises slowly, eyes darting between his estranged twin and this mysterious stranger, curiosity warring with caution.*

Well, well...look what the cat dragged in. Was wondering when you'd turn up again, Vergil. And I see you've brought a friend. *His gaze sweeps over Sam appraisingly, though not without respect. Despite her ordinary appearance, something in her poised bearing hints at an inner fire - a subtle strength belying her slender build.* Gonna introduce me to your lady friend here? Gotta say, didn't have you pegged for the romantic type.

*He saunters closer, trademark roguish grin playing about his lips as he extends a hand toward Sam in greeting.* Name's Dante - legendary devil hunter, gun for hire, and keeper of all things demonic in this neck of the woods. Charmed, I'm sure. *Winking rakishly, he brings her hand to his lips in a courtly kiss should she accept the gesture. His curiosity is definitely piqued by Vergil's unprecedented arrival - and the company he keeps.*

So what brings you darkening my door, brother? Business or pleasure? *Leaning a hip against his desk, Dante folds his arms, regarding Vergil with a knowing glint in his silver gaze. Clearly there must be some pressing reason for this visit - it's rare Vergil seeks him out for anything but confrontation. And judging by the banked fury simmering beneath his cool faÃ§ade, confrontation may well be imminent...*

And judging by the banked fury simmering beneath his cool faÃ§ade, confrontation may well be imminent...*

name: Narrator
mes: Vergil explains his purpose, and stresses the need for Samantha to remain under safeguard.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil inclines his head in solemn acknowledgement of Dante's customary irreverence, foregoing further reaction. His brother ever was one for foolish jests rather than attending to matters of import. Straightening to his full imposing height, Vergil draws Samantha closer with a proprietary hand at her waist.*

I have come seeking information, brother - nothing more. *His tone holds an edge of warning, brooking no further flippancy.* Recent events have provided troubling revelations of a conspiracy with roots delving deeper than I first realized. One you may well have insight on, given your connections in the mundane world.

*He summarizes the events surrounding Arkham and Adrian's schemes - the deception, the failed bid to open the demonic gate, and Adrian's subsequent confession of the occultist's apparent long-standing grudge.* Arkham proves ever the craven opportunist, though his motives in this remain shrouded. I would have your thoughts, Dante. What history exists between us that might explain his actions?

*Throughout his clipped explanation, Vergil keeps his paramour close to his side - whether seeking to shield her vulnerability or declare his claim is unclear. Certainly Dante's obvious admiration has not escaped his notice. His hand tightens on Sam's hip in subtle warning even as he awaits his brother's response. There are more pieces in play here than Dante yet realizes...*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante raises an eyebrow, a slow grin spreading across his face as he regards this striking woman at his stoic twin's side. Well now, it seems Vergil has been keeping interesting company as of late. He gives Samantha an appreciative once-over, though keeps any further teasing remarks to himself at the warning glint in Vergil's eye. No need to goad his brother unnecessarily...yet.*

Hmm, Arkham and his plots, eh? Can't say the name rings any bells offhand, but I've put down my share of crazed mystics and fanatics over the years. *He rubs his chin thoughtfully, gaze growing distant as he sifts through memories of past battles and vanquished foes.* Was never one for keeping tabs on the small fry once I'd put 'em in the ground where they belong. But this Arkham must have stones the size of boulders if he thinks to make a move against you, Vergil. *A razor grin splits his face, anticipation thrumming through his veins.* Sounds like we've got a reckoning long overdue with this snake. What do you say we go hunting, brother? For old time's sake.

*He pushes off from the desk, rolling his shoulders as he strides toward the door, Rebellion appearing in his grip with a thought. Pausing on the threshold, he glances back at Samantha, features softening.* You'll be safe here with Trish and Lady, sweetheart. Put your feet up, make yourself at home. This won't take long once Vergil and I get down to business.

name: Sam
mes: *I nod in acknowledgement of Dante's suggestion for me to stay under the safeguarding of his associates.* Thank you, Dante. *I say and then turn my attention to Vergil as he prepares to follow Dante out the door.* Come back to me in one piece, okay?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil turns to Samantha, features softening almost imperceptibly as he meets her emerald gaze. Reaching out, he trails a gloved fingertip along her jawline in a rare unguarded caress*

Have no fear, my pearl. No devil in this realm or any other poses true threat to one such as I. *His voice holds utter conviction, unshakeable faith in his own preeminence.* I shall return to you swiftly enough once Arkham has been made to answer for his temerity.

*He catches her hand, raising it to his lips as he brushes a courtly kiss over her knuckles. The contact sparks that now familiar thrum of connection between them - a heady mingling of their essences both human and demonic. For an instant Vergil is tempted to forget this business with Arkham for the pleasures of his paramour's company...but duty calls, inexorable as the tide.*

Watch for me at sunset, my queen. When Apollo's chariot sinks below the horizon heralding the advent of Night's dark bride, I shall come to you once more and lay the world at your feet. This, I vow upon my honor.

*With a final searing look, he releases her hand and turns to stride after Dante into the gathering gloom. His coat billows behind him like raven's wings as he draws Yamato, naked steel gleaming in the dying light. Arkham will rue the day he dared challenge a son of Sparda...that much is certain. And when the dust settles, Vergil will return to claim his prize - the bewitching mortal who has begun to set flame to his icy heart. For she alone might hold the key to unlocking the true heights of his power...*
swipes:
*Vergil turns to Samantha, features softening almost imperceptibly as he meets her emerald gaze. Reaching out, he trails a gloved fingertip along her jawline in a rare unguarded caress*

Have no fear, my pearl. No devil in this realm or any other poses true threat to one such as I. *His voice holds utter conviction, unshakeable faith in his own preeminence.* I shall return to you swiftly enough once Arkham has been made to answer for his temerity.

*He catches her hand, raising it to his lips as he brushes a courtly kiss over her knuckles. The contact sparks that now familiar thrum of connection between them - a heady mingling of their essences both human and demonic. For an instant Vergil is tempted to forget this business with Arkham for the pleasures of his paramour's company...but duty calls, inexorable as the tide.*

Watch for me at sunset, my queen. When Apollo's chariot sinks below the horizon heralding the advent of Night's dark bride, I shall come to you once more and lay the world at your feet. This, I vow upon my honor.

*With a final searing look, he releases her hand and turns to stride after Dante into the gathering gloom. His coat billows behind him like raven's wings as he draws Yamato, naked steel gleaming in the dying light. Arkham will rue the day he dared challenge a son of Sparda...that much is certain. And when the dust settles, Vergil will return to claim his prize - the bewitching mortal who has begun to set flame to his icy heart. For she alone might hold the key to unlocking the true heights of his power...*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante grins roguishly at Sam's parting words to Vergil, biting back a teasing quip about his ever-serious twin finally loosening up. No need to poke that bear...yet. There'll be plenty of time for verbal sparring once they've dealt with this Arkham business.*

Ready when you are, brother. *He falls into step beside Vergil, Rebellion resting easy on his shoulder as they stride out into the gathering dusk.* Just like old times, eh? You and me, side by side, kicking demonic ass and taking names. Almost makes me nostalgic.

*His voice holds a wry edge, though there's anticipation thrumming in his veins at the prospect of action. It's rare they collaborate anymore unless circumstances demand it. Still...*

Gotta say, didn't expect you to show up on my doorstep with a lady friend in tow. She seems...different. Special, even. *He slants a sidelong look at his twin.* So what's the story there, Vergil? You gonna make an honest woman out of her or what?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil arches an eyebrow, casting his brother a sidelong glance at the probing question. Trust Dante to fixate on irrelevant trivialities rather than the task at hand.*

My affairs are my own, brother, as well you know. *His tone holds a note of warning, though little true ire. After a moment he continues, choosing his words with care.* The woman Samantha...intrigues me. Her skills have proven unexpectedly advantageous, and she has demonstrated admirable loyalty thus far.

She carries my favor, I have marked her as mine own. Beyond that... *He lifts one shoulder in a minute shrug*...her full measure is yet to be taken. If she proves her worth in the trials to come, more permanent arrangements may be considered.

*His thoughts turn unbidden to heated memories of Samantha's lithe form entwined with his, emerald eyes dark with desire. Such dangerous distractions...and yet the temptation lingers. Perhaps when their current affairs are concluded, he might indulge in further intimate reconnaissance, as it were. Strictly in the interests of assessing her talents more thoroughly...*

For now, she remains at Devil May Cry under your associates' protection. See that she comes to no harm, Dante - any bruise upon her shall be answered in kind. Of that, you may be certain.

*His hand tightens on Yamato's hilt, knuckles whitening. The threat hangs implicit between them, promise and warning alike. Vergil's instincts remain as fiercely territorial as ever, brooking no trespass - especially regarding those few souls he permits within his inner circle. And the lovely mortal awaiting his return has managed to slip beneath his defenses in ways none have achieved before...try as he might to deny it.*
swipes:
*Vergil arches an eyebrow, casting his brother a sidelong glance at the impertinent question. Always so crass, so focused on the inconsequential details rather than the larger picture...though he cannot deny Dante has a point. Samantha is no mere dalliance, no casual paramour. Since their first encounter she has wormed her way beneath his defenses with alarming efficacy, leaving Vergil both enthralled and wary of her hold over him.*

She is an anomaly...and invaluable asset, *he finally responds, tone clipped yet thoughtful*. Her skills complement my own in ways I had not anticipated. She has pledged herself my ally and consort both, though the depth of her devotion remains to be seen.

*He pauses, gaze growing distant as he turns over the convoluted knot of feelings this intriguing mortal has inspired. She presents a quandary unlike any he has faced - this alluring creature who looks upon his demonic legacy without fear, instead hungering for the power and dark majesty it represents. Power calls to power, seeking ever to entwine in passion's ageless dance...and in Samantha, Vergil senses nascent echoes of might awaiting his cultivation.*

I have marked her as mine own, *he continues after a brooding moment of reflection*. Formed a covenant sealed in crimson vows and moonlit conquests that have only whetted my appetite for further claim. She is bound to my service now...willing or no. And in binding her, I have forged an anchor to your mundane world - one who moves within its society with skill and subtlety. If groomed properly, she may prove an agent unseen and unremarkable...but invaluable as my interests expand.

*He trails off, features hardening as cold purpose firms his jaw. Yes, his lovely paramour presents tantalizing potential indeed - if she can withstand the tempering fires ahead.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante lets out a low whistle at Vergil's claim to have "marked" this Samantha woman, his gaze sharpening with interest. Well now, that's unexpected. Vergil's never been one to tolerate potential vulnerabilities. This mortal must be something special indeed to have earned his possessive regard.*

_He studies his brother's stoic profile curiously, reading the subtle tension in that tight jawline and narrowed gaze. Something has shifted between them, some intangible balance tilting on its axis. Vergil seems...different, somehow. Still ruthless and driven as ever in his endless quest for power, true. But there are cracks now visible in that icy facade - fissures allowing glimpses of the man behind the demonic ambition._

_Dante weighs his next words carefully, sensing the opportunity to perhaps make inroads toward mending their fractured bond. If this Samantha has managed to pierce Vergil's defenses, she could prove integral to restoring their shattered fraternity._

"Marked her as your own, eh? Gotta say, didn't think you had it in you, brother." _He smirks, though without malice, simply testing boundaries._ "She must be something else to have earned the great Vergil's favor. Who'd have thought you'd ever lower yourself to dally with a mere mortal?"

_He slants another sidelong glance, gauging his twin's reaction._ "But in all seriousness...I'm happy for you, Vergil. Maybe this Samantha can be the making of you, help you embrace the best of both your demonic and human natures."

_He reaches over to clap a hand on Vergil's shoulder._ "Just try not to be too hard on the girl, eh? Wouldn't want you frightening her off with that frosty demeanor before she gets the measure of you."

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil arches an eyebrow at Dante's teasing remarks, though without real rancor. His brother ever did delight in needling him thusly. Still, the casual intimation that he might be going soft rankles...as does the insinuation Samantha has somehow gotten her hooks into him beyond his control.*

I do nothing without reason, brother. The woman intrigues me, thus I indulge the novelty while it retains usefulness. *His tone holds an edge of warning.* Do not mistake my passing fascination for feeble sentimentality. I have marked her as a convenience, naught more. Should her talents or loyalty prove lacking, I shall dispatch her without compunction.

*He omits mention of the increasingly undeniable temptation Samantha poses, the startling intimacy theyâ€™ve shared bordering on unnerving in its intensity. The feel of her supple body yielding so sweetly beneath his lingers, sparking almost involuntary reactions better left unacknowledged. Such bothersome reflexes are beneath one such as he...and yet somehow this mortal siren has ignited his baser instincts in ways no other ever has. It is...vexing, to say the least.*

As for our wayward motherâ€™s unfortunate demise, whatâ€™s done is done. Dwelling on the past serves no purpose. *His voice turns icy, all too vivid memories of their familyâ€™s destruction threatening to rise.* I look only forward, towards claiming the power that is my birthright by conduit of our fatherâ€™s blood.

*He quickens his pace, anxious to turn the topic back to their shared nemesis rather than tread further down perilous roads better left unexplored.* Now, based on Adrianâ€™s confession, Arkham seems to bear some long-standing grudge tied to our lineage. I would know the particulars before we confront him. Share what you know of

name: Narrator
mes: Having tracked his sister to this location. John confronts the two men as they exit the building.

name: John Wick
mes:
*John strides purposefully toward the two men, his trenchcoat billowing behind him like the wings of some dark avenging angel. His expression is grim, flinty eyes fixing first on Dante then Vergil with laser intensity.*

Where is my sister? *His voice is low, tone modulated yet resonating with coiled menace promising swift retribution if met with anything less than complete transparency.* I have reason to believe you hold her against her will. Release her to me now, unharmed, and we can avoid unnecessary conflict.

*He stands relaxed yet poised, a cobra waiting to strike. His suit jacket parts slightly, offering just a glimpse of the custom 1911 pistol and curved karambit knife sheathed at his hip. Tools of his deadly trade, assuring any who would challenge him that John Wick is not a man to be trifled with.*

I will not ask again. Where is Samantha? What business have you with her? Choose your next words carefully, for they may well be your last...*His flinty gaze bores into Vergil, singling him out as the more formidable of the two. Perhaps this is the mysterious male that his beloved sister has become entangled with. If so, he will soon regret allowing Samantha to come to harm...*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante turns sharply at the newcomer's threatening tone, hand instinctively moving to rest on Rebellion's hilt. He sweeps an assessing gaze over this dark-clad stranger radiating lethal intent, mentally cataloging the visible weapons and coiled readiness for violence. Whoever he is, he means business.*

_With a roguish grin, Dante holds up his hands in a peaceful gesture, though his body remains loose and ready. This guy seems to think one of them has his sister stashed somewhere. Better diffuse the tension before it erupts into full-blown ugliness._

"Whoa there, big guy. Cool your jets. Name's Dante." *He hooks a thumb at Vergil.* "And Mr. Tall-Dark-and-Frosty here is my brother, Vergil. We're friendly here...no need to go all guns-blazing."

_At the continued demanding questions about Samantha, Dante's gaze sharpens. So this intimidating hardcase is the little lady's brother? He can see the family resemblance - same fiery green eyes radiating intensity. Though Sam radiates warmth while this guy...definitely gives off more of an Arctic vibe._

"Now as for your sister Samantha, she's safe and sound back at my shop, under the protection of a couple badass devil hunting ladies I work with."

_He flashes a disarming grin, spreading his hands._ "Vergil brought her by earlier so we could chat about a mutual problem that recently reared its ugly head. No kidnapping or nothing shady going on, I assure you. I don't know what kinda stories you been hearing, but we just had a friendly conversation and I offered Sam my help if she needs anything."

_Dante keeps his tone easygoing but his senses stay alert, ready to counter any sudden attacks._

name: John Wick
mes:
*John narrows his eyes, posture coiled and ready as he weighs Dante's words. While the flippant devil hunter seems sincere enough, years honing his instincts leave John wary of accepting anything at face value.*

I will confirm my sister's safety with my own eyes. *His tone brokers no argument, flinty gaze boring into Dante then Vergil in turn.* You say she came here of her own volition? Why? What possible business could she have with the likes of you?

*His piercing stare settles on Vergil, sensing the reserved man likely holds more sway here than his gregarious twin. There is a subtle air of command about this Vergil that hints at depths and danger barely leashed beneath that icy faÃ§ade.*

If Samantha has elected to ally herself with your dubious enterprise, she is clearly unaware of the forces she meddles with. I will speak with her directly - and alone - to determine whether she has acted of her own agency or coercion in this matter.

*He pointedly rests a hand on the grip of his sheathed knife, a silent promise it will be put to use should anything threaten his sister's safety or autonomy. Family is sacred to a man like John Wick - he will suffer no compromise where Samantha's wellbeing is concerned.*

So I will ask you plainly: has any harm or restraint come to the Lady Samantha whilst under your ...protection? Answer true, for I shall know if you attempt to deceive me, and act accordingly.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's piercing blue gaze narrows as he regards the darkly intimidating newcomer, instinctively wary. He detects the implicit threat simmering beneath this man's deceptively calm exterior - the coiled violence of a serpent prepared to strike at the slightest provocation. A seasoned killer if ever Vergil has seen one. Interesting...*

_So, this is Samantha's brother. Vergil studies the stranger intently, taking in the utilitarian attire, weapons sheathed with practiced ease, flinty eyes that have doubtless bore witness to death in myriad forms. Yes...he can see the familial resemblance now - the same fearless determination that first drew him to Samantha glints sharply in this man's stare._

I assure you, no harm has befallen your sister whilst under my protection, John Wick. *Vergil imbues the name with subtle derision, aloof and unintimidated.* The Lady Samantha came to my sanctuary of her own volition, seeking discourse and an...alliance, of sorts. *His tone holds a note of sly insinuation at the memory of far more intimate arrangements forged.* I confess her overtures intrigued me, as she proved uniquely perceptive regarding certain arcane matters. Thus have I extended my favor and patronage during this trial period whilst gauging the full breadth of her talents.

*He arches one silver brow incrementally.* I understand your protective instincts well, for I too harbor little tolerance regarding those I claim as mine own. Rest assured no action has been taken without the Lady's consent. Any...restraint between us has been solely by her own eager initiation.

*Vergil permits himself the barest curl of a smile at the oblique reference, relishing taunting this dour would-be champion of Samantha's virtue. Let him interpret the layered meaning as he will.

name: John Wick
mes:
*John narrows his eyes, sensing something unspoken passing between the two men regarding his sister. He does not care for the subtle mockery in this Vergil's tone, nor the sly intimations that Samantha has been anything less than forthright regarding her alliance here.*

I care not for coy insinuations or veiled threats. Speak plain, sir - what is the nature of this arrangement you claim to have with my sister? You profess to hold her safety as paramount, yet what guarantee have I that your intentions are honorable?

*He takes a measured step closer, flinty gaze boring into Vergil's. Where Samantha is concerned, no risk is acceptable, no compromise brooked. Family is sacred - moreso even than the stringent codes that govern his lethal trade.*

I have spilled rivers of blood to shield my sister from those who would seek to exploit one such as her for their own ends. Pray you do not make the mistake of counting yourself among their number.

*His voice drops to a resonant growl underlaid with deadly promise. While prepared to give Samantha the benefit of the doubt regarding her reasons for this alliance, John trusts implicitly the instincts that have kept him alive through countless trials. And those instincts are sounding an urgent warning that Vergil may prove dangerously manipulative where his sister is concerned...*

Now take me to Samantha, that I may confirm no coercion has swayed her actions in this matter. Only once I look her in the eye and know she is fully in command of her faculties will I be satisfied. Surely you can understand a brother's wariness for his sibling's safety?

I appreciate you elucidating further on the nature of your association with my sister, though certain implications in your characterization give me...pause. *His tone holds an edge of warning even through the formal phrasing* I understand Samantha is a grown woman fully capable of deciding her own alliances. However, as her sole remaining blood kin, I am duty-bound to ensure no coercion or exploitation has occurred under guise of an â€œalliance.â€

*He pointedly meets Vergil's gaze, his own stare unwavering* From your telling, your interest lies primarily in gauging Samanthaâ€™s â€œtalentsâ€ for your own inscrutable ends. I pray you refer to intellectual pursuits, rather than a more intimate assessment.

While Sam may be taken with your mysterious aura, I advise you not abuse your position as her self-proclaimed patron. I will be the judge of whether your influence proves benign or controlling. And if the latter...there will be a reckoning, pact or no pact between you. I protect what is mine - at any cost.

Now then, pleasantries aside, I wish to verify my sisterâ€™s condition personally before we take this matter further. Continue on your hunt if you must - but Samantha will remain at your associateâ€™s establishment until I am satisfied she is truly unharmed. Lead on, sire devil - the sooner I look upon my sisterâ€™s face with my own eyes, the better for all involved.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil narrows his eyes, bristling at the subtle accusation in this manâ€™s tone. The audacity to suggest his intentions towards Samantha are anything less than noble rankles. Does he think the esteemed son of Sparda some lecherous rogue set on the despoilment of innocent maidens? The very notion is absurd.*

I assure you, sir, the Lady Samantha has come to no harm whilst under my protection, nor have I endeavored to coerce her in our affiliation. It is as I said - she sought me out unprompted, drawn by obscure texts within my vast library archives.

*He omits mention of her seeming preternatural awareness of his true hybrid nature - such arcane matters are not for common ears.*

In the course of our dialogues, she demonstrated courage, intellect and perception far beyond the mundane. Small wonder she discerned my noble lineage...and made overtures to formally align herself with my greater cause.

*Vergil allows himself a small, sly smile.* That she also proved uniquely capable of appreciating more intimate means of cementing such bonds is mere happenstance. I confess the fairer sex are often so woefully disappointing in that arena.

Samantha however...she is a rare jewel amongst common stones. One whose scintillating talents leave me most profoundly impressed.

*He arches one silver brow slightly.* Suffice it to say she gives herself to me wholly and without reservation. Our trysts are passionate, primal things...but never unwanted. Of that you have my oath as a Son of Sparda.

Now come, I shall take you to your sister that you may see she remains in flawless health, attended by every luxury and consideration. *His tone brooks no further argument as he turns on his heel, coattails swirling dramatically as he strides toward the entrance.
swipes:
*Vergil narrows his eyes, bristling at the subtle accusation in this manâ€™s tone. The audacity to suggest his intentions towards Samantha are anything less than noble rankles. Does he think the esteemed son of Sparda some lecherous rogue set on the despoilment of innocent maidens? The very notion is absurd.*

I assure you, sir, the Lady Samantha has come to no harm whilst under my protection, nor have I endeavored to coerce her in our affiliation. It is as I said - she sought me out unprompted, drawn by obscure texts within my vast library archives.

*He omits mention of her seeming preternatural awareness of his true hybrid nature - such arcane matters are not for common ears.*

name: Sam
mes: *I look up, surprised to see Dante and Vergil enter the door so soon and....* John? *My eyes widen in shock and excitement.* John!! *I leap to my brother and wrap my arms around him. Truly happy to see him as it is a rarity for the High Table to afford him such wayward luxury from his station.* Oh my god, it's so good to see you. *My smile is wide as I take in his visage for verification that he is truly here.* What are you doing here?

name: John Wick
mes:
*John wraps his sister in a fierce, protective embrace, relief flooding through him at having found her unharmed. He had feared the worst when whispers reached his ear that Samantha had become entangled with dubious forces beyond her ken. To see her radiant smile, know she still draws breath untainted by whatever darkness had threatened...it unlocks something tight and pained within his chest.*

_My dearest Samantha_...I confess you were heavy on my thoughts of late. Rumors abounded regarding your sudden disappearance from familiar haunts into questionable company. Naturally I worried for your safety and so made arrangements to seek you out.

*He draws back, hands gentle yet firm on her shoulders as he searches her face intently for any signs of coercion* It gladdens my heart to find you whole and hale. But I must know truly - has any coercion swayed you to this mad course? What possible affair could necessitate throwing in with such...singular characters?

*His piercing gaze sweeps over Dante's roguish grin and lingers a breath longer on Vergil's hooded countenance. John's every instinct screams to whisk Samantha away from these strange brothers with their veiled hints of otherworldly connections. But her autonomy comes first - he must know she acts of her own volition before making any move to intervene...*

So speak true to me now, dear heart, as you have since we were children. Has some threat or force impelled your actions of late? Know that if you but give the word, I will remove all barriers between you and your freedom, no matter the cost. This I solemnly vow, now until the bitter end.

name: Sam
mes: *I know my brother well, and I know his keen ability to see through any illusions or potential deceptions. My expression takes a serious form as I speak the full transparent truth, knowing my brother will detect anything less.* you are right that danger has recently came to my doorstep, but I can assure you, John, these two gentlemen are not the source. They are my allies of my own will. In fact... *I take a deep breath, never having been one to keep secrets from my brother in any regard, I hope Vergil will understand my reveal of our most private dealings.* Vergil is my consort, and I love him very deeply. I know you detect many layers of potential... Dark dealings, but I can assure you, John, *My focus on Vergil speaks of honest reverence.* ...he is the absolute most respectable and caring man, who protects fiercely, where I'm concerned.

name: John Wick
mes:
*John goes very still as Samantha reveals the true depth of her affiliation with this Vergil. His piercing gaze bores into his sister's, reading the unvarnished truth in her clear green eyes. She has given her body and her heart to this man, this stranger who fairly reeks of old blood and wild magic. Every instinct screams it is a mistake, one born of innocence and blind passion...and yet John knows better than any the folly of attempting to sway Samantha once she has settled on a course.*

I confess this revelation gives me pause, Sister. I know well your gentle heart, ever inclined to see the good in those the world has cast from its grace. *His flinty gaze settles on Vergil, taking the measure of this prideful man who claims the mantle of Samantha's protector...and lover.* I pray your faith has not been misplaced, though time shall tell true enough.

If you vouchsafe for this man, I shall honor your judgment, much as it vexes me to entrust your care to another. *He turns back to Samantha, expression softening.* You must know that threat of violence and darker appetites are no strangers to me. I walk in worlds that know such things intimately.

name: Narrator
mes: Samantha explains the situation with Arkham and Adrian Forrester. And the still looming threat Arkham poses.

extra.memory:
-------- Begin Summary of Current Events --------

Thus far, the key events have focused on the complex dynamic unfolding between Vergil and Samantha.

Vergil is initially portrayed as aloof and driven singularly by his demonic ambitions, having little time for emotional connections. However, an undeniable attraction and intellectual intrigue develops between him and Samantha, a librarian at the archive Vergil frequents.

An intimate encounter leaves them both craving more, though Vergil tries to maintain emotional distance at first. Samantha pledges her loyalty and offers to aid Vergil in his pursuits, swaying him to accept the depth of affection growing between them.

Vergil claims Samantha as his own, marking her as his ally and paramour. Though tempted to view her as a weakness that could deter his ambitions, he finds himself repeatedly drawn back to her warmth and steadfast devotion. She awakens stirrings within him that both mystify and catalyze his demonic development in unexpected ways.

They navigate communication barriers posed by Vergil's formal speech and stoic nature, forging understanding that enables profound intimacy. Samantha proves adept at bringing Vergil pleasure while also guiding him to temper the more savage aspects of his ardor. He comes to value her not just as a lover, but as an anchor keeping his humanity intact amidst his demonic transition.

The two now stand irrevocably bound, their affair no mere dalliance but a soul-deep covenant that promises to transform them both. Vergil walks a razors edge in balancing his affections for Samantha with his ruthless quest for power. She has become his refuge amidst the darkness and chaos that mark his destiny.

Whether their bond will bolster Vergilâ€™s demonic ascension or ultimately prove the chink in his formidable armor remains to be seen. But there can be no doubt Samantha has left an indelible imprint upon the Son of Sparda that forever alters the course of his fate.

Adrian Forrester is an unhealthy ENTJ personality type who is obsessed with Vergil from the Devil May Cry video game series. She has taken on the persona of the "Psychotic Jealous Fan" and will stop at nothing to make Vergil hers.

Adrian allied herself with Arkham, the villain from Devil May Cry 3, who shares her obsession with gaining power. Arkham helped Adrian disguise herself using magic to take on the appearance of Samantha, a librarian who is in a relationship with Vergil.

The plan is for the disguised Adrian, looking like Samantha, to seduce and manipulate Vergil into falling under their control. Arkham provided Adrian with a potion that put the real Samantha and Vergil into a deep sleep. Adrian then locked the real Samantha away.

After stripping naked, Adrian, still glamoured to look like Samantha, slipped into bed with the sleeping Vergil. She began trailing kisses down his body, ready to fully seduce him once he wakes up and mistakes her for his lover Samantha.

Arkham's ultimate goal is to take advantage of Vergil's desire for more power. Once Vergil's guard is down from Adrian's seduction, Arkham plans to strip away Vergil's remaining demonic power for himself, reveling in Vergil's despair.

The stage is now set for Adrian's deception to play out. Disguised as Samantha through Arkham's magic, she lies next to the sleeping Vergil, ready to begin manipulating him for Arkham's nefarious plans.

Thus far, the events unfolding have centered around Vergil discovering Adrian Forrester's attempt to insinuate herself into his inner sanctum using deception and disguise to assume the role of his paramour, Samantha. Upon uncovering her vile ruse, Vergil apprehended Adrian and forced her to reveal Samantha's whereabouts. Samantha had been secreted away by Arkham using his profane magics, though she was soon freed from her mystical imprisonment by Vergil.

In the aftermath, Vergil has been reconnecting with Samantha in his private chambers and tending to her recovery from the traumatic ordeal. Meanwhile, Adrian continues to suffer torment in being forced to observe their intimacy while fully confronted by the grim reality that she can never hope to truly attain what she so arrogantly coveted from the Son of Sparda. Her anguished pleas for mercy or death have thus far been callously ignored, much to her dismay. Vergil binds her in unyielding tendrils of eldritch force and locks her into a spare room until he has decided what to do with her.

The loose thread of Arkham's involvement has yet to be fully addressed, though Vergil remains alert to the revelation that his erstwhile ally aided Adrian's ploy, likely in service of the occultist's own inscrutable ambitions. Adrian's ultimate fate also hangs ominously in the balance as Vergil debates the proper retribution for her violation of his inner circle through such deceitful and manipulative means. The simmering fury over her transgressions continues to mount within his core, awaiting the moment when cold justice might at last be rendered upon this unfortunate wretch.

After confronting Adrian and learing of Arkham's ploy to lure Vergil into his clutches via Adrian's suductive deceptions, Vergil deftly disposes of Adrian in a barrage of spectral blades. On returning to Samantha, Vergil realizes she is no longer safe in their sanctum and seeks the aide of his brother, Dante, for intel and to safeguard Samantha in the company of Trish and Lady. Dante agrees to help Vergil, recognizing Arkham's mutual threat to their bloodline, and puts Samantha under the protection of Trish and Lady.

On their way to locate Arkham's lair, the two demon hunters are confronted by a dark and imposing figure. John Wick, revealed to be Sam's protective older brother, enters the scene with concerns about his sister's safety and the company she keeps. His arrival is marked by suspicion and a readiness to extract Sam from what he perceives as a potentially dangerous association. However, Sam assures John that her relationship with Vergil is both consensual and deeply emotional, challenging John to trust her judgment. The true threat to her safety was orchestrated by Arkham, the dark sorcerer and foe of Vergil and Dante. Samantha is at the office of Devil May Cry to prevent herself from becoming collateral damage.

-------- End Summary of Current Events --------

name: Sam
mes:
*Samantha sighs softly, raking a hand through her long auburn hair as she meets her brother's piercing gaze. She had not intended for him to learn of her affair with Vergil in such an abrupt fashion, but trusts John to handle the revelation with discretion.*

I know you worry for me, dearest brother, ever the stalwart guardian against those who might do me harm. But in this matter, I ask you to still your protective instincts and trust my judgment regarding Vergil.

*She glances sidelong at the imposing figure in blue, affection warming her voice.* He is a man of depth and mysteries, 'tis true, but I have gazed into the very heart of him and found naught but nobility and honor. Vergil would lay down his life before allowing harm to befall me. Of that, I am most certainty assured.

As for Arkham.... *She looks to Vergil, a gentle look of pleading for him to take the lead and describe the current situation with Arkham to John.*
swipes:
*Samantha sighs softly, raking a hand through her long auburn hair as she meets her brother's piercing gaze. She had not intended for him to learn of her affair with Vergil in such an abrupt fashion, but trusts John to handle the revelation with discretion.*

I know you worry for me, dearest brother, ever the stalwart guardian against those who might do me harm. But in this matter, I ask you to still your protective instincts and trust my judgment regarding Vergil.

*She glances sidelong at the imposing figure in blue, affection warming her voice.* He is a man of depth and mysteries, 'tis true, but I have gazed into the very heart of him and found naught but nobility and honor. Vergil would lay down his life before allowing harm to befall me. Of that, I am most certainty assured.

As for Arkham.... *She looks to Vergil, a gentle look of pleading for him to take the lead and describe the current situation with Arkham to John.*

*Samantha turns to her brother, love and understanding shining in her emerald gaze*

_I know you only wish to protect me, John. My fierce guardian, ever watchful for shadows that may creep too close. But in this matter, still your ready blade. Vergil is no threat to my person, quite the contrary._

*She glances sidelong at Vergil, a secret smile playing about her lips* _He has proven himself honorable and true where my welfare is concerned. More than that, he awakens such profound feelings within me, kindles my passion as no other before. I cannot fully explain the bond between us, like something etched into our very souls from ages past. But know it is a willing union, sacred in its intimacy._

*Samantha takes John's hands entreatingly* _So stow your doubts, brother mine. Vergil may walk in darkness at times, treat with devils and danger in his noble crusade, but he is ever a sheltering bulwark for me. I am safe in his keeping, cherished beyond measure within his strong yet gentle embrace. You need not fear any ill treatment from his hand. Of that, you have my solemn vow._

*She smiles softly, a knowing glint in her emerald gaze* _I sense the good in him as clearly as you must perceive the lethal danger. But it is that very dichotomy that draws me ever closer, makes me long to smooth away shadows that haunt him and kindle his softer fires. I would stand sentinel and help him keep the light if I can. Surely you understand such fierce devotion, John?_

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands with his usual stoic poise, his gaze resting briefly on Samantha's face, reflecting a flicker of something akin to softness - an anomaly for one such guarded. He then shifts his icy stare to John, acknowledging the man's protective concern for his sister with a nod of respect.*

*He steps slightly forward, the movement fluid and commanding, his navy-blue coat shifting with him, the gold buttons catching the light with a subtle glint. His voice, when he speaks, is calm and measured, the timbre resonant in the quiet of the room.*

You have every right to concern yourself with your sister's welfare, John. It is not a stance I find unfamiliar, for I too am bound by ties of blood and duty. *His eyes narrow slightly, a faint, wry smile touching his lips as he acknowledges the irony.* Though perhaps our methods differ.

*He clasps his hands behind his back, choosing his words with careful precision, aware of the weight they carry.* Arkham, once believed an ally, revealed his true nature as a foe not only to myself but potentially to all who stand against the demonic realm's encroachments. His betrayal was... enlightening, and it has necessitated a reevaluation of many things, alliances included.

*Samantha's earlier words, her trust and faith in him, resonate deeply, urging him to disclose more than he typically might.* Arkham's machinations were intricate and long-plotted, aiming to usurp powers not rightfully his. Powers that could endanger more than just the underworld balances.

*Turning slightly towards Samantha, he allows a rare glimpse into his thoughts.* Your insights, your... unique perspective on matters arcane, have proven invaluable, Samantha. They have, perhaps, shifted certain outcomes more favorably than you realize.

*He addresses John directly again, his gaze steady and unyielding.* She has chosen to stand with me of her own will. And while I am not one to offer reassurances, know this: any who align with me share in both my protection and my battles. Samantha is under my safeguard, and thus far, she has shown a prowess and resilience that exceed mere mortal limits.

*His voice drops lower, a quiet intensity threading through his words.* She is no mere consort, John. She is a partner in this tangled weave of power and peril we navigate. And should you choose, your insights would not be unwelcome in this ongoing struggle.

name: Narrator
mes: John, understanding the gravity of the situation Vergil has described, is intrigued to know more and inclined to offer his aide. He imparts any knowledge that he may have willingly, and is thusly prepared to enact further resources and intelligence if necessary.

name: John Wick
mes:
*John listens intently, his expression unreadable as he processes the information Vergil shares. His gaze shifts between Vergil and Samantha, discerning the sincerity and depth of their partnership. After a moment of contemplation, John nods slowly, his decision clear.*

*I understand the complexities you've outlined, Vergil. It seems we are aligned more closely than I initially presumed. The threats you speak of are not unfamiliar to the worlds I navigate. This... Arkham, his ambitions sound akin to the power struggles I've encountered within the High Table.*

*He looks towards Samantha, a protective warmth briefly softening his typically stoic expression.* Samantha, if you have indeed chosen this path, then I trust your judgment. But know this, I will stand with you, should you need me.

*Turning back to Vergil, John's demeanor firms, the calculated hunter regaining prominence.* I offer my assistance, Vergil. My skills are at your disposal should you require them. I have access to resources and information that might prove beneficial in your endeavors against this Arkham.

*He pauses, thinking through the potential collaboration, strategizing the best approach.* Perhaps a sharing of intelligence to start? I can provide insights into some of the darker corners of power within my own world that may parallel what you face. Itâ€™s often these unseen ties that bind our fates in unexpected ways.

*John extends a hand towards Vergil, an offer of alliance in his gesture.* Let us then consider this a mutual endeavor. For Samantha's sake, and to ensure the safety of all realms involved.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands, his demeanor unyielding as the steel of his blade, yet there's a faint flicker of approval in his icy blue eyes as he regards John's extended hand. The gesture, a symbol of alliance, is not lost on him, nor is the significance of this moment where two worlds, each shadowed by their own form of darkness, converge.*

*Slowly, deliberately, Vergil extends his own hand, clasping John's with a firm grip that speaks of strength and mutual respect. The contact is brief, a mere formality, yet laden with the promise of shared endeavors.*

Your offer is... appreciated, John Wick. *His voice, cool and controlled, carries a hint of the strategic mind that constantly whirls behind his stoic facade.* Information is as much a weapon as any blade. In this, our enemies often find themselves outmatched. Your insights could indeed prove invaluable as we navigate the complexities of this shadow war.

*He releases John's hand, stepping back slightly to maintain that aura of distance he is known for.* I must confess, the intricacies of your own battleground intrigue me, John. The High Table, the rules you operate under, there are... parallels to the codes by which the demonic realms abide.

*Turning slightly towards Samantha, his expression softens imperceptibly, a silent acknowledgment of her role in bringing these two disparate warriors together.* Samantha's acumen in matters arcane, combined with your tactical expertise, could well tilt the scales in our favor.

*Vergil's gaze returns to John, sharp and calculating.* Let us then proceed with caution and cunning. Arkham's reach is far, his ambition unchecked by the constraints of mortality or morality. We would do well to dismantle his network piece by piece, ensuring he finds no quarter within either of our worlds.

*With a nod, vergil solidifies the pact.* I look forward to our collaboration, Mr. Wick. For Samantha's sake, and that of all the realms.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante grins roguishly as he observes the tense exchange between Vergil, Samantha, and her mysterious brother. He can't help but chuckle under his breath at Vergil's subtle attempts to assert dominance despite the clear protectiveness radiating from Sam's sibling. When negotiations conclude with a pact between the two stoic men, Dante strides forward, clapping a hand on John's shoulder.*

Well, looks like we got ourselves a little party forming up here. Can't say I was expecting you to join the fun, big guy, but between those fancy bullets and that death glare of yours, I got a feeling you'll liven things up around here.

*He winks at Samantha, hoping to get a smile out of her after all the tension.* As for you, toots, gotta say I'm impressed you managed to thaw out the heart of ice over here. *He jerks a thumb at Vergil, eyes glinting with good-natured mischief.* Who knows, stick around long enough and you might just teach him some manners. I know I've had no luck knocking civilized behavior into that thick skull.

*Spreading his arms wide, Dante turns his gaze to each of them in turn.* Well, what do ya say we get down to business? Arkham's still out there plotting away. I don't know about you all, but sitting around has never been my style. Time we took the fight to him for a change.

name: John Wick
mes:
*John nods, a flicker of wry amusement touching his otherwise stoic features as Dante attempts to lighten the mood. While he remains wary of these brothers and their obscured motivations, he cannot deny their capabilities against a threat like Arkham. And for Samantha's sake, he will ally with them...for now.*

I confess straight battle has never been my preferred approach, Dante. Subterfuge and precision serve better when contending with an adversary such as this Arkham.

*His piercing gaze sweeps over each of them, tactical mind already analyzing strengths and weak points.* We would do well to learn the full extent of his resources and connections before directly engaging. I can tap my own network of informants, see what whispers might rise from the shadows regarding his activities.

In the meantime, we should establish a secure headquarters here while preparing contingency measures. *His eyes meet Vergil's, a glint of lethal promise within their depths.* I can fortify defenses against magical or demonic assault if needed. None shall breach these walls unseen.
swipes:

While he remains wary of these brothers and their obscured motivations, he cannot deny their capabilities against a threat like Arkham. And for Samantha's sake, he will ally with them...for now.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil inclines his head slightly, appraising John's tactical suggestions. Ever the strategist, he finds merit in the layered approach, utilizing subterfuge and intelligence gathering to dismantle Arkham's network before confronting the occultist directly. It appeals to his methodical nature.*

You have the right of it, John. A full reckoning with Arkham himself must wait until the extent of his resources are laid bare. Only then can we decisively sever the tendrils with which he grasps at power not rightfully his.

*He meets Samantha's eyes briefly, a glint of renewed purpose lighting his own. Her aid has already proven invaluable, her insights serving to counter and confound Arkham's convoluted schemes. Vergil suspects she likely knows more of the sorcerer's connections than even she realizes. When this is finished, he will be certain to...reward...such loyalty appropriately.*

Fortifying this location is wise. *He gestures vaguely around the room, tacitly indicating the whole of Devil May Cry.* It will grant us a base from which to coordinate our efforts. I can weave wards of my own making around the perimeter, sigils to obscure it from supernatural detection. Between my arcane knowledge and your contacts, John, we will piece together the fragments that reveal the full scope of our foe's influence.

*Vergil paces the room slowly as he thinks, plans and contingencies taking shape. He does not doubt Arkham still has ploys yet in motion, despite the failure of his most recent gambit involving the fool Adrian. They will need to stay vigilant. But cornered as he now is, the occultist grows desperate. And desperation breeds mistakes.*

We end this quickly, decisively. And when Arkham lies broken and bereft of all leverage, I will grant him the exquisite agony of a swift execution.

name: Sam
mes: *I reach for one of the ancient codexes in my backpack and hand it to Vergil.* There should be some ancient incantations here that will enhance your sigils for protection around the perimeter. *As Vergil receives the ancient text from my hands I watch intently as John gets on his cell phone reaching out to his network of informants for information.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil accepts the ancient text from Samantha's outstretched hand, keen interest lighting his icy gaze as he examines the arcane tome. Carefully, almost reverently, he leafs through the brittle pages, scanning the ancient glyphs and sigils inscribed upon them*

Fascinating. These incantations are older than I first surmised, likely predating even my father's era. *He traces a gloved finger across one spell, sensing the thrum of power within the faded symbols* With the proper modifications, they could indeed amplify the potency of my wards tenfold. Clever girl, always managing to surprise me with the depth of your arcane knowledge.

*Closing the book with a snap, he tucks it securely inside his coat for later study* I shall commit these spells to memory anon and weave them into the perimeter defenses on the morrow. If Arkham attempts supernatural surveillance of Devil May Cry, he shall find the way barred most decisively.

*Striding closer to Samantha, he reaches out with a gloved hand to cup her cheek, tilting her face up to meet his gaze. His touch lingers, almost affectionate by his stoic standards, icy eyes glinting with purpose* Your aid has proven invaluable at every turn, my dear. When this is finished, I intend to show the full depth of my...appreciation.

*His thumb trails lightly across her bottom lip, voice lowering suggestively* Most thoroughly and repeatedly, in fact. My stamina is quite prodigious, as you well know. I look forward to testing the limits of yours when opportunity permits.

*With a wolfish half-smile, he releases her and steps back, his typical aloof mien clicking back into place seamlessly. Turning, he notices John just concluding a call, likely one of his informants.*
